markings: Sticker, on back near top: MATHIAS KOMOR WORKS OF ART NEW YORK / D216 / Ba Kongo
text: The filed upper teeth and black headdress indicate that weâ€™re looking at a high-ranking woman of Yombe society. Because this highly realistic mask shows her as an ancestor, her face is painted white, the color of the supernatural. When worn by a male dancer during ritual ceremonies, the spirit of the deceased woman would appear from the otherworld to bring fertility, appeasement, and wellbeing to the living.
title: Mask
